title: Write the Equation in Standard Form
text: The equation is not in standard form. It can be written as standard form by divding 100 both sides and get $$\frac{x^2}{25}+\frac{y^2}{4}=1$$

title: Determine Whether the Major Axis is Horizontal or Vertical
text: Since $$4<25$$ and 25 is in the $$x^2$$ term, the major axis is horizontal.

title: Find the endpoints of the major axis.
text: The endpoints will be the x-intercept. Since $$b^2=25$$ then $$b=-5$$ or $$b=5$$. The endpoint of the major axis are (-5,0), (5,0).

title: Find the endpoints of the minor axis.
text: The endpoints will be the y-intercepts. Since $$a^2=4$$, then $$a=-2$$ or $$a=2$$. The endpoints of the minor axis are (0,2), (0,-2).

title: Elimination of Choices
text: The graph with y-intercepts (0,2), (0,-2) and x-intercepts (-5,0), (5,0) is the answer.
